maml:description.maml:para: The New-Log function is used to create a new log file or Windows Event log. A log object is also created and either saved in the global PSLOG variable (default) or sent to the pipeline. The latter is useful if you need to write to different log files in the same script/function.

maml:Description.maml:para: Create or append to a Plain Text log file Log Entry Example: 03-22-2018 12:37:59.168-240 INFORMATION: Generic Log Entry
Path to log file.
Optionally define a header to be added when a new empty log file is created. Headers only apply to files, and do not apply to CMTrace files
If log file already exist, append instead of creating a new empty log file.
Maximum size of log file.
Maximum number of log files to keep. Default is 3. Setting MaxLogFiles to 0 will keep all log files.
When UseLocalVariable is True, the log object is not saved in the global PSLOG variable, otherwise it's returned to the pipeline.
Messages written via Write-Log are also written back to the host by default. Specifying this option, disables that functionality for the log object.
When writing to the log, the data stream name (DEBUG, WARNING, VERBOSE, etc.) is not included by default. Specifying this option will include the stream name in all Write-Log messages.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Create or append to a Minimal log file Log Entry Example: Generic Log Entry

Optionally define a header to be added when a new empty log file is created. Headers only apply to files, and do not apply to CMTrace files

When writing to the log, the data stream name (DEBUG, WARNING, VERBOSE, etc.) is not included by default. Specifying this option will include the stream name in all Write-Log messages.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Create or append to a Windows Event Log
Specifies the name of the event log.
Specifies the name of the event log source.
Define the default Event ID to use when writing to the Windows Event Log. This Event ID will be used when writing to the Windows log, but can be overrided by the Write-Log function.
When UseLocalVariable is True, the log object is not saved in the global PSLOG variable, otherwise it's returned to the pipeline.

When writing to the log, the data stream name (DEBUG, WARNING, VERBOSE, etc.) is not included by default. Specifying this option will include the stream name in all Write-Log messages.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new log file called 'myScript.log' in the current folder, and save the log object in $PSLOG
Create a new log file called 'myScript.log' if it doesn't exist already, and add a custom header to it. The log format used for logging by Write-Log is the CMTrace format.
Create two different logs that can be written to depending on your own internal script logic. Remember to pass the correct log object to Write-Log!
Create a new log called 'PowerShell Scripts' with a source of 'MyScript', for logging to the Windows Event Log.

maml:description.maml:para: The Show-Log function is used to display a log file, event log, or log object.

maml:Description.maml:para: Log object to show
Event log to show
File log to show
Log object to show
Event log to show
File log to show

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new log file called 'myScript.log' in the current folder, and save the log object in $PSLOG
Create a new log file called 'myScript.log' if it doesn't exist already, and add a custom header to it. The log format used for logging by Write-Log is the CMTrace format.
Create two different logs that can be written to depending on your own internal script logic. Remember to pass the correct log object to Write-Log!
Create a new log called 'PowerShell Scripts' with a source of 'MyScript', for logging to the Windows Event Log.

maml:description.maml:para: Write to the log and back to the host by default.

The Write-Log function is used to write to the log and by default, also write back to the host. It is using the log object created by New-AHGLog to determine if it's going to write to a log file or to a Windows Event log. Log files can be created in multiple formats

maml:Description.maml:para: The text you want to write to the log. Not limiting this to a string, as this function can catch exceptions as well

The type of log entry. Valid choices are 'Error', 'FailureAudit','Information','SuccessAudit' and 'Warning'. Note that the CMTrace format only supports 3 log types (1-3), so 'Error' and 'FailureAudit' are translated to CMTrace log type 3, 'Information' and 'SuccessAudit' are translated to 1, while 'Warning' is translated to 2. 'FailureAudit' and 'SuccessAudit' are only really included since they are valid log types when writing to the Windows Event Log.
Include the stream name in the log entry when writing CMTrace logs
Do not write the message back to the host via the specified stream By default, log entries are written back to the host via the specified data stream.
Event ID. Only applicable when writing to the Windows Event Log.
The log object created using the New-Log function. Defaults to reading the PSLOG variable.
PassThru passes the log entry to the pipeline for further processing.
The text you want to write to the log. Not limiting this to a string, as this function can catch exceptions as well

The type of log entry. Valid choices are 'Error', 'FailureAudit','Information','SuccessAudit' and 'Warning'. Note that the CMTrace format only supports 3 log types (1-3), so 'Error' and 'FailureAudit' are translated to CMTrace log type 3, 'Information' and 'SuccessAudit' are translated to 1, while 'Warning' is translated to 2. 'FailureAudit' and 'SuccessAudit' are only really included since they are valid log types when writing to the Windows Event Log.
Include the stream name in the log entry when writing CMTrace logs
Do not write the message back to the host via the specified stream By default, log entries are written back to the host via the specified data stream.
Event ID. Only applicable when writing to the Windows Event Log.
The log object created using the New-Log function. Defaults to reading the PSLOG variable.
PassThru passes the log entry to the pipeline for further processing.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the log object from $PSLOG and write to the log.
Use the log object saved in $myLog and write to the log.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Write-AHGLog 'WMI query failed - Access denied!' -LogType Error -PassThru | Write-Warning

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will write an error to the event log, and then pass the log entry to the Write-Warning cmdlet.
